oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Mickey Gilley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Mickey Gilley (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mickey Gilley; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Promotion for Hallmarks of Country Music featuring Rick Phillips introducing Mickey Gilley -- (0:37) Hallmarks tune [featuring Rick Phillips introduction voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:11) Veteran's Association benefits radio spot hosted by Phillips -- (01:55) I Overlooked an Orchid (Mickey Gilley) -- (04:40) Phillips introduces Gilley and inquires about Gilley's 'over-night success' -- (06:56) San Antonio Rose (Mickey Gilley) -- (09:25) Re-enlistment commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (10:30) Faded Love (Mickey Gilley) -- (12:05) Gilley reflects on ""Faded Love"" and ""San Antonio Rose;"" additionally, Gilley is asked to reflect on his time performing in the 1960s -- (15:30) Lonely Wine (Mickey Gilley) -- (17:34) Survivor's benefits of military families commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (18:30) Turn Around (Mickey Gilley) -- (21:18) Gilley reveals he recorded ""Turn Around"" three times, and Phillips inquires as to when ""It's the End of the Line"" was recorded -- (23:32) It's the End of the Line (Mickey Gilley) -- (24:15) Phillips and Gilley both describe the change in Gilley's voice -- (24:49) Room Full of Roses (Mickey Gilley) -- (27:36) V. A. school benefits commercial spot hosted by Phillips -- (28:03) Veteran's Association commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (28:33) Gilley reflects on when he first released ""Room Full of Roses"" -- (31:25) Don't be Angry (Mickey Gilley) -- (33:50) Red Cross commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (35:00) I Love You So Much it Hurts Me (Mickey Gilley) -- (36:55) Gilley expresses his thanks to his audience, and Gilley reflects on his relationship to Jerry Lee Lewis -- (42:02) United States Customs commercial spot hosed by an unidentified host -- (42:56) City Lights (Mickey Gilley) -- (45:37) Gilley recaps ""City Lights"" and his future plans -- (48:36) Fraulein (Mickey Gilley) -- (51:26) Is it Wrong (Mickey Gilley) -- (53:20) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (55:27) Phillips introduces the guest disk jockey, Paul Berlin, and both praise Gilley -- (58:24) Phillips and Berlin reflect on how KNUZ-KQUE was a country station
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Insert is of program information. The insert features time stamps.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gilley, Mickey; Phillips, Rick;
